meanings.definition: The state of being isolated or detached from others.
meanings.sent1: Her insularity made it difficult for her to make friends at the new school.
meanings.sent2: The island's insularity protected it from outside influences.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insularity, he found solace in the company of his books.
meanings.sent4: The insularity of the small village was shattered when a highway was built through it.
meanings.sent5: The insularity of the castle on the hill gave it an air of mystery and intrigue.

meanings.sent1: His insularity prevented him from accepting new ideas or perspectives.
meanings.sent2: The insularity of the small town led to conflicts with neighboring communities.
meanings.sent3: Despite his insularity, he couldn't help but laugh at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: The insularity of their group created a barrier to understanding different cultures.
meanings.sent5: Her insularity was like a wall that kept her from seeing the world beyond.
